NanoVLM-222M is a tiny but capable model that sees and understands images, then turns that understanding into words. Think of it as a lightweight brain that looks at a picture and tells you what it sees ‚Äî like a mini assistant that can describe visuals in natural language.
Built using just a few hundred lines of clean PyTorch code, nanoVLM is perfect for developers, tinkerers, and researchers who want to explore image-text understanding without burning through massive compute. It‚Äôs not made for flashy demos ‚Äî it‚Äôs made to be simple, fast, and educational. If you‚Äôre curious about how visual language models work under the hood, this one‚Äôs for you.
A Vision Transformer (SigLIP-B/16-224) as the image encoder
A SmolLM2-135M language decoder
A thin projection layer to connect vision to language
‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Install NanoVLM World`s Smallest Model Locally?

So you‚Äôve started a side project.
You bought the domain, spun up a repo, maybe even slapped together a landing page. You're pumped. This is it. The idea that's going to finally lift you out of your day job (which you only kind of hate) and into indie hacker stardom.
But here‚Äôs the uncomfortable truth:

It‚Äôs probably going to fail.
Not because you‚Äôre lazy. Not because your code is trash. And definitely not because you lack vision.
It‚Äôs just... how this works.
Let me explain.
The numbers? They‚Äôre brutal. Something like 90% of side projects go nowhere. They fizzle out in silence‚Äîone dusty commit at a time.
But if you‚Äôve been around devs, you already know this. You've seen dozens of "Coming Soon" pages that never... well, came.
And yet, people still start new projects. They still stay up till ‚Ä¶

articles.description:
In the fiery forges of Mordor, where molten metal flows like Sauron‚Äôs wrath, there exists a guardian forged by elven smiths‚Äîthe RNF-100-3. This heat-shrink tubing, crafted with the precision of Celebrimbor and the resilience of Mithril, shields Middle-Earth‚Äôs circuits from the Dark Lord‚Äôs chaos. Let us unveil why this 2:1 shrink marvel is the unbreakable vambrace of electronics!

Chapter 1: Forged in the Fires of Eregion
RNF-100-3 is no mere orcish scrap. Tempered in the Elven Forges of TE Connectivity, it bears three ancient virtues:
Mithril Resilience: 2:1 shrink ratio, clinging to wires like Gandalf‚Äôs grip on the One Ring.
Why Sauron‚Äôs minions fail:
Generic Tubes: Crumble like Isengard‚Äôs walls under Entish rage.
Chapter 2: The Fellowship of Applications
Mines of Moria (Robotics):
Armors dwarven machinery in grease-filled depths, defying Balrog sparks and orcish neglect. ‚ÄúYou shall not corrode!‚Äù
Eagles‚Äô Flight (Aerospace):
Shields Gondor‚Äôs airships from stratospheric frost, steadier than Gwaihir‚Äôs wings.
Rohan‚Äôs Chargers (EV Tech):
Protects horse-lord chariots (Teslas) from Saruman‚Äôs oily sabotage. ‚ÄúTheoden King‚Äôs battery shall not fail!‚Äù
Houses of Healing (Medical Devices):
Guards life-saving scrolls (defibrillators) with the purity of elven medicine.

The Three Rings of Power
Narya (UL/CSA Certified): Ignites safety compliance, brighter than Gandalf‚Äôs staff.
The Shadow of Mount Doom
Cheap Clones: Split like Shelob‚Äôs webs under pressure.
The Prophecy of the Third Age
the RNF-100-3 shall guard the circuits of men. Its grip shall tighten like the One Ring‚Äôs pull, yet it shall defy corruption.‚Äù
Epilogue: The Return of the King
References:
The Silmarillion of Thermoplastics (Elven Archives of TE Connectivity)
The Lay of MIL-Spec Craftsmanship (Dwarven Scrolls of Certification)

articles.author: keploy
articles.description:
Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent-to-Agent (A2A).
Below is the roadmap for our deep dive into MCP (Model Context Protocol) and A2A (Agent-to-Agent):
Why We Need MCP & What Problem It Solves: MCP standardizes how AI assistants connect to data sources and tools, eliminating brittle point-to-point integrations and enabling seamless context sharing across systems.


What Is A2A (Agent-to-Agent): A2A defines a vendor-agnostic, secure messaging protocol for agents to delegate tasks and collaborate, reusing standards like HTTP, JSON-RPC.


Key Differences Between MCP & A2A: While MCP focuses on connecting LLMs to external tools, A2A enables peer-to-peer agent orchestration; we‚Äôll compare their communication patterns, security models, and use cases


Hands-On Walkthrough: Connecting to a Goog‚Ä¶
articles.title: Mastering Mcp To A2a: Everything A Developer Needs To Know

articles.description:
US President Donald Trump has signed a bill criminalizing nonconsensual artificial intelligence-generated deepfake porn, which also requires websites to take down any illicit images within 48 hours.
Trump signed the bill into law on May 19, known as the TAKE IT DOWN Act, an acronym for Tools to Address Known Exploitation by Immobilizing Technological Deepfakes on Websites and Networks.
The bill, backed by first lady Melania Trump, makes it a federal crime to publish, or threaten to publish, nonconsensual intimate images, including deepfakes, of adults or minors with the intent to harm or harass them. Penalties range from fines to prison.
Source: Melania Trump
Websites, online services, or apps must remove illegal content within 48 hours and establish a takedown process.

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Jamie Dimon, the CEO of JPMorgan, said his bank will soon allow its clients to buy Bitcoin, but it won‚Äôt custody the cryptocurrency.
‚ÄúWe are going to allow you to buy it,‚Äù Dimon said at JPMorgan‚Äôs annual investor day on May 19. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not going to custody it. We‚Äôre going to put it in statements for clients.‚Äù
CNBC reported that Dimon also remarked on his long-held skepticism about crypto assets, pointing to their use in money laundering, sex trafficking and terrorism.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think you should smoke, but I defend your right to smoke. I defend your right to buy Bitcoin,‚Äù he said.
Michael Saylor comments on Dimon‚Äôs announcement. Source: Michael Saylor
JPMorgan will offer clients access to Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded funds (ETFs), CNBC reported, citing sources familiar with the situation. Until now, the firm has limited its crypto exposure primarily to futures-based products, not direct ownership of digital assets.
Related: Morgan Stanley advisers can officially pitch Bitcoin ETFs
JPMorgan rival Morgan Stanley has also moved to offer spot Bitcoin ETFs to qualifying clients. Spot Bitcoin ETFs in the US have seen significant adoption, with almost $42 billion in total aggregate inflows since they launched in January 2024.¬†
Dimon‚Äôs Bitcoin bashing history
Dimon has long been skeptical of Bitcoin, labeling it a scam that he had no interest in buying in 2018 and calling it ‚Äúworthless‚Äù during the 2021 crypto bull market.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve always been deeply opposed to crypto, Bitcoin, etc.,‚Äù he said during a Senate Banking Committee hearing in 2023. ‚ÄúThe only true use case for it is criminals, drug traffickers, money laundering, tax avoidance.‚Äù
‚ÄúIf I were the government, I‚Äôd close it down,‚Äù he said.
At the 2024 World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, Dimon said Bitcoin ‚Äúdoes nothing. I call it the pet rock,‚Äù which came after the asset topped $100,000 for the first time.¬†¬†
Magazine: Arthur Hayes $1M Bitcoin tip, altcoins ‚Äòpowerful rally‚Äô looms: Hodler‚Äôs Digest
articles.title: JPMorgan boss says bank users can soon buy Bitcoin

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
The US Department of Justice is reportedly conducting a probe over Coinbase‚Äôs contracted customer service agents in India, who accepted bribes in exchange for allowing criminals access to user data.
According to a May 19 Bloomberg report, DOJ investigators are looking into the data breach, which Coinbase disclosed to the public on May 15. The exchange reported that a group of customer support contractors ‚Äî subsequently fired ‚Äî ‚Äúabused their access to [...] systems to steal the account data for a small subset of customers.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe have notified and are working with the DOJ and other US and international law enforcement agencies and welcome law enforcement‚Äôs pursuit of criminal charges against these bad actors,‚Äù said Coinbase‚Äôs chief legal officer, Paul Grewal, according to Bloomberg.

Related: New Zealand man arrested in $265M crypto scam tied to FBI probe
Though ‚Äúno passwords, private keys, or funds were exposed‚Äù according to Coinbase, the data breach resulted in social engineering attacks targeting users, including a Sequoia Capital partner, with losses estimated at up to $400 million. The attackers also attempted to extort $20 million from Coinbase in exchange for not disclosing the breach, which the company refused.
Backlash in the courts
The attempted social engineering attacks have resulted in Coinbase users filing several lawsuits against the exchange, alleging that the company mishandled their personal data. One user, a retired artist named Ed Suman, reported losing $2 million to the scammers.
Coinbase‚Äôs stock price fluctuated following the news of the breach and an unrelated probe from the US Securities and Exchange Commission over its reported ‚Äúverified user‚Äù numbers. Cointelegraph reached out to Coinbase for comment but had not received a response at the time of publication.

articles.title: DOJ is investigating Coinbase data breach‚Äî Report

Chinese news outlet Landian News reported on May 19 that Shenzhen-based printer company Procolored has been distributing Bitcoin-stealing (BTC) malware alongside official drivers. A total of 9.3 BTC worth over $953,000 have been stolen, according to the report. Crypto tracking and compliance firm Slow Mist described how the malware operates in a May 19 X post:

Franklin said its new offering integrates Summer.fi, a decentralized finance (DeFi) lending platform, to allow companies to deposit stablecoin-denominated payroll reserves into smart contract-based lending pools.
These funds are lent to vetted borrowers, and companies earn yields while retaining access to their capital. Companies maintain full custody throughout the process, and smart contracts used are audited to reduce risk.

Understanding a Bitcoin liquidation map is imperative in dealing with the inherent volatility of the crypto market. The visual tool showcases probable liquidation levels, indicating where large orders may cause cascading price changes.¬†
This post explores how to interpret a Bitcoin liquidation map, allowing you to trade smarter in the volatile world of cryptocurrency.
What is liquidation in crypto trading?
In cryptocurrency trading, liquidation happens when an exchange forcefully closes a trader's leveraged position due to insufficient margin to pay losses. This usually occurs when the market moves sharply against the position.¬†
Long liquidations occur when prices fall, affecting traders who bet on an uptrend. Short liquidations happen when prices unexpectedly rise, impacting those who bet‚Ä¶
